title: Future of care home provider Four Seasons thrown into doubt as £350m sale collapses
text:
The future of Four Seasons was thrown into fresh doubt as a £350m deal to sell a chunk of the care homes collapsed on Thursday night.

Britain’s second-largest care home provider with about 320 sites and 22,000 staff, was due to offload 185 freehold properties to H/2 Capital, the US hedge fund that is its principal creditor.

The arrangement fell through after “certain conditions” were not met or waived on both sides, the companies said.

Four Seasons, previously owned by private equity firm Terra Firma, is home to 16,000 elderly residents.

Separately, it has been renegotiating lower rents for the remaining 135 leasehold homes to keep a lid on costs, having previously withdrawn rent from landlords...
